Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The odometer class keeps track of the robot's (x, y, theta) position.
    Author:
    Rodrigo Silva, Dirk Dubois, Derek Yu, Karim El-Baba, Michael Smith, Younes Boubekeur

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        private Odometer​()
        This is the default constructor of this class. It initiates all motors and variables once.It cannot be accessed externally.

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer​()
        Returns the Odometer Object. Use this method to obtain an instance of Odometer.
        Returns:
        the Odometer Object

      • run

        public void run​()
        This method is where the logic for the odometer will run.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getXYT

        public double[] getXYT​()
        Returns the Odometer data.

        Writes the current position and orientation of the robot onto the odoData array. odoData[0] = x, odoData[1] = y; odoData[2] = theta;

        Parameters:
        position - the array to store the odometer data
        Returns:
        the odometer data.

      • update

        public void update​(double dx,
                   double dy,
                   double dtheta)
        Adds dx, dy and dtheta to the current values of x, y and theta, respectively. Useful for odometry.
        Parameters:
        dx -
        dy -
        dtheta -

      • setXYT

        public void setXYT​(double x,
                   double y,
                   double theta)
        Overrides the values of x, y and theta. Use for odometry correction.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        y - the value of y
        theta - the value of theta in degrees

      • setX

        public void setX​(double x)
        Overwrites x. Use for odometry correction.
